author: Special Correspondent
text:
The emergence of the People’s Welfare Front (PWF) has threatened the position of the AIADMK and the DMK and it was PWF’s presence and not the DMDK’s indecision on alliance that kept the DMK on tenterhooks, VCK founder Thol. Thirumavalavan said on Tuesday.

Addressing a campaign meeting at Avadi, the former MP said most commentators said that the indecision on part of the DMDK was the reason for the existing deadlock. However, it was the formation of the PWF that rattled the Dravidian parties. Mr. Vijayakant has put the DMK in an agonising state by keeping his options open. Only the PWF has been able to form an alliance successfully. We have emerged as a credible threat to the major parties in Tamil Nadu,” he said.

CPI (M) State secretary G. Ramakrishnan said it was indeed true that the Left had aligned with the AIADMK and DMK in the past. While it tried its best to reform these parties, there was no change in their functioning. “We then decided that there has to be an alliance for the people. This was our intention when we formed this alliance,” he added. MDMK general secretary Vaiko said the two Dravidian parties were experts in misleading the people of Tamil Nadu.

CPI leader R. Mutharasan spoke.
title: ‘PWF, a threat to Dravidian parties’
